line_1: Cry, That is Empire! shun her baleful path,
line_2: Her Words are Slavery, and her Touch is Death!

line_1: Moderns, to hit the self-same path,
line_2: Place figures in a room at Bath:

line_1: As it uneath mote find its watry path
line_2: So on he passed, till he comen hath

line_1: With choicest Flowers strow all the joyful Path,
line_2: Gay as his Looks, sweet as his tuneful Breath.
There dread the spight-swoln Beldame's wrath,

line_1: Still dost thou strew with thorns my rugged path?
line_2: Will crouch submissive to avert thy wrath?
Tell, O tell the Joys of Bath.
